alert.note: Alert for Bay; Calhoun (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 19 at 12:27AM EDT until further notice by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT/430 AM EDT/ SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Big Bend Florida and Panhandle Florida, including the following counties, in Big Bend Florida, Liberty. In Panhandle Florida, Bay and Calhoun. * WHEN...Until 330 AM CDT /430 AM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1126 PM CDT /1226 AM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 7 inches of rain have fallen in the last 4 Hours. - Small streams will continue to rise quickly as heavy rain from earlier runs off. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Panama City, Lynn Haven, Blountstown, Springfield, Hiland Park, Bristol, Altha, Frink, Clarksville, Abe Springs, Broad Branch, Red Oak, Kinard, Sharpstown, Scotts Ferry, Blountstown Airport, Chipola Park, Chason, Marysville and Hugh Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
